image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: The real challenge for the outback community is beginning as floodwaters start to clear, with critical infrastructure showing signs of serious damage.

title.children: Long road to recovery for Innamincka as receding floodwaters expose damage

image.altText: Adrian Portelli holds several 100 dollar bills in his hand

props.synopsis: The property investor and social media influencer will stand trial in an Adelaide court later this year after pleading not guilty to several charges of conducting an unlawful lottery.

title.children: Adrian Portelli ordered to stand trial over unlawful lottery allegations

image.altText: A woman at SA parliament staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: The SA government's apology in parliament to people affected by the use of pelvic mesh — including "for the pain, embarrassment and gaslighting they've endured" — needs to be followed by practical steps, an advocate says.

title.children: Pelvic mesh apology a 'first step', but advocate calls for lifelong care

image.altText: Six glasses of red wine being held up for a toast, the drinkers' hands are visible

props.synopsis: Australian wine began flowing back into China last year when tariffs were removed, but overall exports are declining significantly.

title.children: Australian wine exports on the slide as world drinks less

image.altText: An Adelaide Lightning player lays the ball up.

props.synopsis: The future of South Australia's women's basketball team is in limbo, with the Adelaide Lightning at loggerheads with the WNBL about the club's future in the national competition.

title.children: Adelaide Lightning in limbo amid stand-off with WNBL

image.altText: A girl smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Behind a schoolgirl's love for her idyllic seaside lifestyle is a fear that if change doesn't come soon, she may be among the last to enjoy her town's true beauty.

title.children: They can't vote yet but these kids want Canberra to know what counts

image.altText: A man in a khaki shirt and hat kneels and holds a bag open for a woman to place a golden bandicoot inside at Wild Deserts

props.synopsis: Prior to the project, the native species had been locally extinct in outback NSW for decades after they were wiped out by pests.

title.children: 'Genuine excitement' as scientists release bilbies, bandicoots into wild

image.altText: Man in light blue suit stands against book shelf

props.synopsis: With a hub based at heritage-listed Ayers House, South Australia's History Festival begins today and runs for the month of May.

title.children: South Australia's History Festival launches with nearly 600 events

image.altText: a brick building with a Lochert Bros sign and a car parked out the front

props.synopsis: A Riverland West company has been fined $129,000 and convicted on two Work Health and Safety Act counts following a serious degloving incident of a 22-year-old worker.

title.children: Citrus packer fined $129k after 22yo worker degloved by machine

image.altText: A woman stands outside coroners court with a photo of her daughter

props.synopsis: The mother of a woman killed randomly by a man who previously experienced "homicidal ideation" has said the "incompetence" of the mental health system contributed to her death.

title.children: Victim's mum says killer 'slipped through the cracks' of system

image.altText: A man near a shark in shallow water.

props.synopsis: A shark has been returned to the ocean after it became stuck in shallow waters off a South Australian beach.

title.children: Trio free shark stuck in shallow waters

image.altText: a speed sign and a turnoff on a road with a car approaching in the distance

props.synopsis: Residents near major South Australian highways say roads are "not up to scratch" with "bandaid" repair jobs amid proposed changes to federal infrastructure funding that could see the state receive less.

title.children: Anger over highway 'patch jobs' amid less federal cash for SA roads

image.altText: Water splashing into a hand under a water tap. Water tank in the background.

props.synopsis: With many rainwater tanks across the Adelaide Hills running low or on empty due to an ongoing dry spell, two residents say thieves have used water trucks to steal nearly 200,000 litres overnight.

title.children: Nearly 200,000 litres of water stolen from Adelaide Hills tanks, residents say

image.altText: The remains of a large puffed up globe fish sit on the sand of a surf beach.

props.synopsis: As sharks, rays, and other marine life continue to wash up on South Australian beaches, citizen scientists are urged to record the scale of the lingering marine algal bloom event.

title.children: Citizen scientists needed to help sea life amid algal bloom devastation

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor will claim the Coalition's budget deficits would be at least $10 billion smaller than Labor's forecast $150 billion shortfalls over four years.

title.children: Coalition to release 'materially better, in double digits' budget costings

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a black dress stands in a hair salon.

props.synopsis: Small businesses in parts of regional South Australia are feeling the pinch as farmers and their families tighten their belts amid record low rainfall.

title.children: Record dry hurting small businesses in country SA

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: A run of showery and stormy days is soaking Australia's east coast, while a record drought across South Australia and Victoria continues to intensify.

title.children: A wind deviation responsible for SA, Victoria drought and the NSW soaking

image.altText: Four people walking amongst streets with new builds behind them

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, some South Australians could be questioning if their state is part of the race.

title.children: Does South Australia matter this federal election?

image.altText: Bianca Feher sings into a microphone and plays her guitar wearing a green shirt. Tin sheets and bush are behind her.

props.synopsis: South Australia and New South Wales have introduced grassroots music programs to revitalise a struggling regional live music industry, and new research backs their initiatives.

title.children: Live music programs giving regional artists something to sing about

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy talks with a laughing Donald Trump

props.synopsis: The agreement would see Washington and Kyiv jointly develop Ukraine's mineral resources, an arrangement US President Donald Trump has called "money back" for the wartime aid it has received from America.

title.children: US and Ukraine minerals deal could be signed within 'next 24 hours'

image.altText: Man in a suit speaking into a microphone behind a podium while holding up a chart

props.synopsis: A flood of imports into the United States ahead of the Trump administration's tariffs have dampened economic growth.

title.children: US economy shrinks in first quarter of Trump's second term

image.altText: A man in religious dress, with his hands pressed together in prayer.

props.synopsis: As dean of the College of Cardinals, this is supposed to be Giovanni Battista Re's moment. There's just one problem: the 91-year-old won't be in the Sistine Chapel when voting for a new pope begins next week.

title.children: This conclave, some of the most influential cardinals won't even be inside

image.altText: King Charles waving with a smile as he leaves a church service.

props.synopsis: It is the most candid the King has been about his health challenges since being diagnosed in February 2024.

title.children: King Charles opens up about 'frightening' and 'daunting' cancer experience

image.altText: katy perry

props.synopsis: Pop star Katy Perry says online criticism over her recent space trip has left her feeling "battered and bruised", but reassures fans she was "OK".

title.children: Katy Perry says Blue Origin backlash made her feel like a 'human piñata'

image.altText: An Indian border guard raises his hand in a gesture indicating stop to a car with two women in the back.

props.synopsis: Following a deadly militant attack, Pakistan and India have hit each other with a range of tough measures including cancelling visas, which has left families separated and wondering when they will be able to reunite.

title.children: 'We shouldn't have come': The families stranded at the Indian border

image.altText: A yellow pig-nosed turtle with a little skin tag goatee sticks its head above creek water.

props.synopsis: With Australia in the grip of what many consider a biodiversity crisis, here's what the major parties have promised when it comes to nature laws and the environment.

title.children: As election day nears, one topic has been largely ignored: the environment

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson served meals to guests at a fateful lunch at her home on different coloured plates to the one she served herself, a jury has been told.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer tells jury mushroom poisoning deaths were 'a terrible accident'

image.altText: A view of the Jerusalem skyline shrouded in smoke.

props.synopsis: Dry and windy conditions fanned the flames, forcing motorists on the main highway between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv to abandon their cars and run for their lives.

title.children: Israel calls for international help as wildfires erupt near Jerusalem

image.altText: Close up shot of arms holding a small child, whose bare leg and foot are visible.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple could face prosecution after they admitted to using a commercial surrogacy service to have a baby abroad, but experts say the laws need to change.

title.children: Couple who used overseas surrogate to have baby could face prosecution

image.altText: A graphic with 15 faces with the words 'Your Say'

props.synopsis: Some Tasmanians are considering voting for non-major party candidates for the first time at Saturday's federal election, saying they are increasingly dissatisfied with the policies of Labor and the Liberals.

title.children: Some voters considering first-time vote away from major parties

image.altText: Rodney Croome Portrait

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian equality activist of over 30 years says Burnie Council's decision to implement pro-LGBTQIA+ initiatives is "one of the most important milestones" he's experienced.

title.children: Once home to 'most homophobic town', this area's council tries to shake off anti-gay image

image.altText: trans flag 1

props.synopsis: The UK's first openly transgender judge said she plans to take the British government to the European court of human rights over its recent ruling on biological sex.

title.children: UK's first trans judge to challenge gender ruling in European court

image.altText: ABC election analyst Antony Green Election

props.synopsis: The ABC's election guru reflects on the past 36 years at the national broadcaster in the final days before covering his last big poll on-air.

title.children: Antony Green on his most stressful election, proudest prediction and fight against unwieldy ballot papers

image.altText: Kylie Minogue singing on stage

props.synopsis: Pop royalty Kylie Minogue has been honoured for her outstanding contribution to the Australian music industry at this year's APRA Music Awards.

title.children: Kylie honoured for outstanding contribution to Australian music

image.altText: A composite image of two people with blurred faces wearing blue Liberal Party t-shirts.

props.synopsis: Members of a secretive Christian sect are being given instructions on how to lie about their beliefs against voting in elections, in an apparent coordinated effort to campaign for the Liberal and National parties.

title.children: Secretive church sect followers told to deny beliefs on voting, in campaign backing Coalition
